Comment: The King's Gambit. I was tempted to accept, but decided against it.
The King's Gambit. I was tempted to accept, but decided against it.
The King's Gambit. I was tempted to accept, but decided against it.
I was in a puckish mood and had never tried this move.
Luckily, he overlooked 3 Q-R5ch, or I could have been in trouble.
Very poor play on J.B.'s part, in retrospect. He probably should have played 3 Q-R5 ch himself on the previous move. Even here 4 P-N3 wouldn't leave me with much to do except retreat my Queen.
I go for the material grab.
It's just amazing how bad both he and I were at strategy back then. 5 N-B3 develops a piece and breaks the "attack".
With an obvious threat... at least I thought it was obvious. I didn't think he'd actually fall into it, but I figured I'd better start developing.
Development is always good. But you have to always make sure...
